title: Design Thinking-Based Educational Escape Room (EER) Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of core science curriculum concepts and proficiency in digital tool applications
context.additional_context: Applying a design thinking process to create science education escape room games.

learning_goals: Learners can develop one educational escape game scenario based on science concepts.
Learners can conduct EER (Emergency Education Response) design using the five stages of design thinking: empathize, define, ideate, prototype, and test.
Learners can demonstrate collaboration and problem-solving skills in the EER design process through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
